description: This seminar examines the rise of the modern American state, interrogates major transformations in governance in the twentieth century United States, and explores the methodologies and historiographies of the fields of American political development, policy history, and political history. Students read, discuss, and write about historiographical debates in these fields and practice and refine their research and writing skills in producing their own original research paper.
title: Building the Twentieth-Century...
long_title: Building the Twentieth-Century American State: Politics, Policy and Political Development
